sen.j: 井上 勝（いのうえ まさる、1843年8月25日（天保14年8月1日 (旧暦)） - 1910年（明治43年）8月2日）は、江戸時代の武士（長州藩士）、明治時代の官僚。
sen.e: Masaru INOUE (Auguest 25, 1843, to August 2, 1910) was a samurai in the Edo Period (a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain) and a bureaucrat in the Meiji Period.
Masaru INOUE (August 25, 1843, to August 2, 1910) was a samurai in the Edo Period (a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain) and a bureaucrat in the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 最初のAugustのスペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: Masaru INOUE (August 25, 1843, to August 2, 1910) was a samurai in the Edo Period (a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain) and a bureaucrat in the Meiji Period.

sen.j: 位階勲等子爵。
sen.e: He was a viscount in ranks and orders.
He was a viscount in ranks and orders.
He was a viscount in ranks and orders.

sen.j: 通称を弥吉。
sen.e: His common name was Yakichi.
His common name was Yakichi.
His common name was Yakichi.

sen.j: 鉄道発展に寄与し、日本の鉄道の父と呼ばれる。
sen.e: He made contributions to the development of railways in Japan and is called the father of the Japanese railways.
He made contributions to the development of railways in Japan and is called the father of the Japanese railways.
He made contributions to the development of railways in Japan and is called the father of the Japanese railways.

sen.j: 東京駅丸の内中央口の駅前広場に銅像がある。
sen.e: His statue is in the square in front of the Matunouchi Central Exit of the Tokyo Station.
His statue is in the square in front of the Marunouchi Central Exit of the Tokyo Station.
His statue is in the square in front of the Marunouchi Central Exit of the Tokyo Station.

sen.j: 1843年、長州藩士・井上勝行の3男として萩城下に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in the castle town of Hagi.
In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in the castle town of Hagi.
In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in the castle town of Hagi.

sen.j: 野村家の養嗣子となるが、のちに復籍する。
sen.e: He was adopted into the Nomura Family, but was restored to the Inoue Family later.
Although he was adopted into Nomura family as an heir, he was returned to his own family later.
sen.cmt: 「嗣子」訳抜けの他、全文書き換えました。
sen.e: Although he was adopted into Nomura family as an heir, he was returned to his own family later.

sen.j: 1863年（文久3年）に脱藩。
sen.e: He left Choshu Domain in 1863.
In 1863, he escaped from Choshu Domain and became a lordless samurai.
sen.cmt: leftだけでは「脱藩」の持つ意味が伝わらないので書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1863, he escaped from Choshu Domain and became a lordless samurai.

sen.j: のちにイギリスに密航し、1868年（明治元年）までロンドンに留学し、ユニバーシティー・カレッジ・オブ・ロンドン（UCL）にて鉱山技術・鉄道技術などを学ぶ。
sen.e: Later he smuggled himself to England and studied mining and railway technology at Univercity College of London in London until 1868.
Later he smuggled himself into England and studied until 1868 in London where he learned mining and railway technology at University College of London.
sen.cmt: to England をinto Englandに、UnivercityをUniversityに変えた他全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Later he smuggled himself into England and studied until 1868 in London where he learned mining and railway technology at University College of London.

sen.j: 帰国後は新政府に出仕し、新橋駅（品川駅） - 横浜駅間の鉄道や東海道線、日本鉄道会社（東京～青森間）など、鉄道庁長官として鉄道事業の発展に尽力した。
sen.e: After he came back to Japan, he served the new governemtn, working hard as the Minister of Railways for the development of the railway business, such as the railway between Shinbashi (Shinagawa) and Yokohama, Tokaido Main Line, Nippon Railway (between Tokyo and Aomori).

After he came back to Japan, he served the new government, working hard as the Minister of Railways for the development of the railway business, including construction of the line between Shinbashi (Shinagawa) and Yokohama and Tokaido Main Line, and establishment of Nippon Railway Company (railways between Tokyo and Aomori).
sen.cmt: governemtnをgovernmentに変えました。Businessの後のスペ^スを削除しました。後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: After he came back to Japan, he served the new government, working hard as the Minister of Railways for the development of the railway business, including construction of the line between Shinbashi (Shinagawa) and Yokohama and Tokaido Main Line, and establishment of Nippon Railway Company (railways between Tokyo and Aomori).

sen.j: 鉄道事業はのちに、原敬や後藤新平に引き継がれる。
sen.e: The railway business was later taken over by Takashi HARA and Shinpei GOTO.
The railway business was later taken over by Takashi HARA and Shinpei GOTO.
The railway business was later taken over by Takashi HARA and Shinpei GOTO.

sen.j: 早くから鉄道国有化の必要を唱え、鉄道局長時代の1881年に工部卿佐々木高行に対し、民営鉄道の利益優先主義と競合は鉄道発展にマイナスとなるとする「私設鉄道に対する鉄道局長論旨」を提出する。
sen.e: He advocated the need for nationalization of the railways from early on, and in 1881 during his time as Director General of the Railway Agency, he submitted to Takayuki SASAKI, the Minister of Industry then, "the Thesis of the Director General of the Railway Agency concerning Private Railways" that says the profitalism and competition of private railways negatively affects the development of railways.

He advocated the need for nationalization of the railways from early on, and in 1881 during his time as the Director General of the Railway Agency, he submitted to Takayuki SASAKI, the Minister of Industry then, a written opinion titled 'Argument against Private Railways from Director General of Railway Agency' stating that profit-oriented buisiness and competition of private railways would adversely affect the development of railways.
sen.cmt: 後半を書き換えました。
sen.e: He advocated the need for nationalization of the railways from early on, and in 1881 during his time as the Director General of the Railway Agency, he submitted to Takayuki SASAKI, the Minister of Industry then, a written opinion titled 'Argument against Private Railways from Director General of Railway Agency' stating that profit-oriented buisiness and competition of private railways would adversely affect the development of railways.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年）、鉄道庁長官として｢鉄道政略に関する議｣を政府に提出する。
sen.e: In 1891, he submitted to the government "the Discusssion of the Railway Plan" as the Minister of Railways.
In 1891, he, as the Minister of Railways, submitted to the government a written statement titled 'Opinion about Governmental Project on Railways'.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1891, he, as the Minister of Railways, submitted to the government a written statement titled 'Opinion about Governmental Project on Railways'.

sen.j: 幹線鉄道を国有化すべきとする主張は、後の鉄道敷設法（1892年）を生み、鉄道国有法（1906年）につながる。
sen.e: His insistence that the main lines must be nationalized later led to the Railroad Construction Law (1892) and the Railway Nationalization Act (1906).
His opinion that the main railroad lines should be owned by the national government later led to the Railroad Construction Law (1892) and the Railway Nationalization Act (1906).
sen.cmt: 前半を書き換えました。
sen.e: His opinion that the main railroad lines should be owned by the national government later led to the Railroad Construction Law (1892) and the Railway Nationalization Act (1906).

sen.j: しかし鉄道敷設法では、多数の議員が鉄道各社の株主との理由もあってか法案成立に抵抗し、また、田口卯吉（両毛鉄道社長）は、民営鉄道こそが鉄道発展を促すとして井上と対立した。
sen.e: However, regarding the Railrod Construction Law, many councilors were against the bill partly because of the shareholders of the railroad companies, and also Ukichi TAGUCHI (president of Ryomo Railway) argued against INOUE saying that it was private railways that would encourage the development of railways.

Many parliament members were, however, against enactment of the Railroad Construction Law, probably because they were shareholders of railway companies, and Ukichi TAGUCHI (president of Ryomo Railway) opposed INOUE, arguing that it was private railways that would facilitate the development of railways.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Many parliament members were, however, against enactment of the Railroad Construction Law, probably because they were shareholders of railway companies, and Ukichi TAGUCHI (president of Ryomo Railway) opposed INOUE, arguing that it was private railways that would facilitate the development of railways.

sen.j: その結果、鉄道敷設法は民営鉄道促進の余地を広げるものとして修正され、憤った井上は1893年に鉄道庁長官を退官した。
sen.e: As a consequence, the Railroad Construction Law was modified to include private railways, and being furious with this, INOUE resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways in 1893.

As a result, the Railroad Construction Law was modified to give room to promotion of private railways, and being furious with this, INOUE resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways in 1893.
sen.cmt: 前半を書き換えました。
sen.e: As a result, the Railroad Construction Law was modified to give room to promotion of private railways, and being furious with this, INOUE resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways in 1893.

sen.j: 1843年、長州藩士・井上勝行の三男として萩に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in Hagi.
In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in Hagi.
In 1843, he was born as the third son of Katsuyuki INOUE, a feudal retainer of Choshu Domain, in Hagi.

sen.j: 1863年、井上馨、遠藤謹助、山尾庸三、伊藤博文と共に5人でイギリス留学。
sen.e: In 1863, he studied in England with Kaoru INOUE, Kinsuke ENDO, Yozo YAMAO, and Hirobumi ITO.
In 1863, he studied in England with Kaoru INOUE, Kinsuke ENDO, Yozo YAMAO, and Hirobumi ITO.
In 1863, he studied in England with Kaoru INOUE, Kinsuke ENDO, Yozo YAMAO, and Hirobumi ITO.
In 1868, he returned from abroad.
In 1868, he returned from abroad.
In 1868, he returned from abroad.

sen.j: （井上馨と伊藤は1864年に帰朝）
sen.e: (Kaoru INOUE and ITO returned in 1864)
(Kaoru INOUE and ITO returned in 1864.)
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: (Kaoru INOUE and ITO returned in 1864.)

sen.j: 1869年～、造幣頭兼鉱山正を皮切りに、鉱山兼鉄道頭、鉄道頭、工部大輔、鉄道局長、鉄道庁長官を歴任。
sen.e: From 1869 on, he successively took the positions of Head of the Mint and the Supervisor of Mining, Head of Mining and Railways, Head of Railways, Taifu of Industry (Post of Ministry of Industry), the Director General of the Railway Agency, and the Minister of Railways.

From 1869 on, he successively took the positions of Head of the Mint and the Supervisor of Mining, Head of Mining and Railways, Head of Railways, Taifu of Industry (Post of Ministry of Industry), the Director General of the Railway Agency, and the Minister of Railways.

From 1869 on, he successively took the positions of Head of the Mint and the Supervisor of Mining, Head of Mining and Railways, Head of Railways, Taifu of Industry (Post of Ministry of Industry), the Director General of the Railway Agency, and the Minister of Railways.

sen.j: （1872年、新橋～横浜間に鉄道が開業）
sen.e: (In 1872, the railway between Shinbashi and Yokohama was started.)
(In 1872, the railway between Shinbashi and Yokohama was started.)
(In 1872, the railway between Shinbashi and Yokohama was started.)

sen.j: （1874年、大阪～神戸間に鉄道が開業）
sen.e: (In 1874, the railway netween Osaka and Kobe was started.)
(In 1874, the railway netween Osaka and Kobe was started.)
(In 1874, the railway netween Osaka and Kobe was started.)

sen.j: 1878年8月、飯田俊徳を総監督とし、京都ー大津間の逢坂山トンネルを着工。
sen.e: In August, 1878, the construction of the Osakayama Tunnel between Koto and Otsu started with Toshinori IIDA as the general director.
In August, 1878, construction of the Osakayama Tunnel between Kyoto and Otsu started with Toshinori IIDA as the general director.
sen.cmt: constructionの前のtheを削除、Kotoをkyotoとしました。
sen.e: In August, 1878, construction of the Osakayama Tunnel between Kyoto and Otsu started with Toshinori IIDA as the general director.

sen.j: 日本人のみの手によって施工された初のトンネルとなる。
sen.e: It became the first tunnel built only by Japanese.
It became the first tunnel built only by Japanese.
It became the first tunnel built only by Japanese.

sen.j: 1887年5月24日、造幣寮の創業・鉄道の発展に貢献した功績により子爵を授けられる。
sen.e: On May 24, 1887, he was given the title of Viscount because of his contributions to the establishment of the Mint and the development of railways.
On May 24, 1887, he was given the title of Viscount because of his contributions to the establishment of the Mint and the development of railways.
On May 24, 1887, he was given the title of Viscount because of his contributions to the establishment of the Mint and the development of railways.

sen.j: （1889年、東海道線が全通）
sen.e: (In 1889, Tokaido Main Line was completed.
(In 1889, Tokaido Main Line was completed.)
(In 1889, Tokaido Main Line was completed.)

sen.j: 1890年、鉄道庁長官、貴族院議員
sen.e: In 1890, he became the Minister of Railways and a member of the House of Peers.
In 1890, he became the Minister of Railways and a member of the House of Peers.
In 1890, he became the Minister of Railways and a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 1891年、小野義真、岩崎彌之助と共同で火山灰土の原野を開墾して小岩井農場（小岩井農牧株式会社）を創立。
sen.e: In 1891, he founded Koiwai Farm (Koiwai Farm,Ltd.) by cultivating fields of volcanic ash soil with Gishin ONO and Yanosuke IWASAKI.
In 1891, he founded Koiwai Farm (Koiwai Farm,Ltd.) by cultivating fields of volcanic ash soil with Gishin ONO and Yanosuke IWASAKI.
In 1891, he founded Koiwai Farm (Koiwai Farm,Ltd.) by cultivating fields of volcanic ash soil with Gishin ONO and Yanosuke IWASAKI.

sen.j: 小岩井の名称は、三者の姓の一番目の文字をつなげたもの。
sen.e: The name of Koiwai was taken from the first letters of the surnames of these three.
The name Koiwai was coined by combining the first kanji letters of the trio's surnames.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The name Koiwai was coined by combining the first kanji letters of the trio's surnames.

sen.j: （1892年、鉄道敷設法が公布され「鉄道会議」が設置される）
sen.e: (In 1892, the Railrod Construction Law was promulgated and the "Railway Board" was established.
(In 1892, the Railroad Construction Law was promulgated and the 'Railway Commitee' was established.)
sen.cmt: RailrodをRailroadに、BoardをCommitteeにしました。とじかっこ追加。
sen.e: (In 1892, the Railroad Construction Law was promulgated and the 'Railway Commitee' was established.)

sen.j: 1893年、鉄道庁長官を退官。
sen.e: In 1893, he resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways.
In 1893, he resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways.
In 1893, he resigned from the position of the Minister of Railways.

sen.j: 1896年、汽車製造を大阪で設立
sen.e: In 1896, he founded Kisha Seizo in Osaka.
In 1896, he founded Kisha Seizo, a train maker, in Osaka.
sen.cmt: a train maker を追加しました。
sen.e: In 1896, he founded Kisha Seizo, a train maker, in Osaka.

sen.j: 1906年4月1日、勲一等旭日大綬章を受章。
sen.e: On April 1, 1906, he received the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On April 1, 1906, he received the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.
On April 1, 1906, he received the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.

sen.j: （鉄道が国有化される）
sen.e: (The Railways were nationalized.)
(The railways were nationalized.)
sen.cmt: Railwaysを小文字で始めました。
sen.e: (The railways were nationalized.)

sen.j: 1909年、帝国鉄道協会の第3代会長に就任。
sen.e: In 1909, he became the third president of the Imperial Railways Association.
In 1909, he became the third president of the Imperial Railways Association.
In 1909, he became the third president of the Imperial Railways Association.

sen.j: 1910年、鉄道院顧問として視察中のロンドンにて客死。
sen.e: In 1910, he died in London during his visit as an advisor for the Railway Bureau.
In 1910, he died in London during his visit as an advisor for the Railway Bureau.
In 1910, he died in London during his visit as an advisor for the Railway Bureau.

sen.j: 享年68。
sen.e: At the age of 68.
He died at the age of 68.
He died at the age of 68.

sen.j: 養嗣子井上勝純、襲爵。
sen.e: His adopted heir, Katsuzumi INOUE, took over his title.
His adopted heir, Katsuzumi INOUE, took over his title as Viscount.
His adopted heir, Katsuzumi INOUE, took over his title as Viscount.

sen.j: 1964年、品川東海寺大山墓地内にある墓所が鉄道記念物に指定される。
sen.e: In 1964, his grave located in the Daisen Mountain Graveyard of Tokai-ji Temple in Shinagawa was designated as a monument of railways.
In 1964, his grave at Oyama Cemetry of Tokai-ji Temple in Shinagawa was designated as a monument relating to railways.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In 1964, his grave at Oyama Cemetry of Tokai-ji Temple in Shinagawa was designated as a monument relating to railways.

sen.j: 井上は退官後、汽車製造合資会社を大阪で設立。
sen.e: After resignation, INOUE founded Kisha Seizo Company in Osaka.
After resignation, INOUE founded Kisha Seizo Goshi Gaisha in Osaka.
After resignation, INOUE founded Kisha Seizo Goshi Gaisha in Osaka.

sen.j: この会社は以来、数々の機関車や客貨車を製造してきたが、1912年、汽車製造株式会社（通称 汽車会社）に名を変え、1972年、川崎重工業に吸収合併されて幕を閉じた。
sen.e: This company produced various locomotives and carriages, but in 1912 its name was changed to Kisha Seizo Company (commonly called Kisha Kaisha), and in 1972, it was merged into Kawasaki Heavy Indutries.

This company had produced various locomotives and passenger and freight carss since the establishment, but in 1912 its name was changed to Kisha Seizo Kabushiki Kaisha (commonly called Kisha Kaisha), and in 1972, it was merged into Kawasaki Heavy Industries, Ltd. to end its history.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。
sen.e: This company had produced various locomotives and passenger and freight carss since the establishment, but in 1912 its name was changed to Kisha Seizo Kabushiki Kaisha (commonly called Kisha Kaisha), and in 1972, it was merged into Kawasaki Heavy Industries, Ltd. to end its history.

tit.j: 萩市自然と歴史の展示館
tit.e: Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City
Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City
Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City

sen.j: JR山陰本線萩駅構内にある旧萩駅舎は、現在、萩市自然と歴史の展示館として再利用されている。
sen.e: The former Hagi station building in Hagi station of JR Sanin Main Line is used as the Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City.
The former Hagi station building remaining in the yard of Hagi station of JR Sanin Main Line is currently used as the Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City.
sen.cmt: in Hagi Stationを remaining in the yard ofに書き換えました。usedの前にcurrentlyを追加しました。
sen.e: The former Hagi station building remaining in the yard of Hagi station of JR Sanin Main Line is currently used as the Museum of Nature and History of Hagi City.

sen.j: 展示館には萩の紹介コーナーと鉄道コーナーがあり、鉄道資料とともに、井上に関する数々の資料が展示されている。
sen.e: The Museum has exhibitions about Hagi and railways, and they show various documents about INOUE as well as about railways.
The Museum has exhibitions about Hagi and railways, and they show various documents about INOUE as well as about railways.
The Museum has exhibitions about Hagi and railways, and they show various documents about INOUE as well as about railways.

sen.j: イギリス留学の費用は、2004年現在の貨幣価値にして約5億円で、130日の航海後の4人は飢えたカラスのようだったと記録されている。
sen.e: The expenses for his study in Endland were about 500 million according to the 2004 currency value, and the four of them looked like starving crows after the 130-day voyage.

The expenses required to study in England at that time were about 500 million yen in terms of the monetary value as of 2004, and there is a record describing the four people after the 130-day voyage as starving crows.
sen.cmt: 全文を書き換えました。また「4人」となっていますが、「5人」の誤記と思われます。原文どおり4人にしておきます。
sen.e: The expenses required to study in England at that time were about 500 million yen in terms of the monetary value as of 2004, and there is a record describing the four people after the 130-day voyage as starving crows.
